There's been two questions just today for testing code that's designed for
use within a container. I see these questions a lot. I vote to add an entry
for this in the JUnit FAQ.
 
With regards to this issue, please search the archives (
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/ <http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/>
) I'm confident you can find the answer to your question.
 
Here's just one hint: Cactus http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/
<http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/> . There are other approaches as well...
 
Good Luck!
-Chris Eppstein

Subject: [junit] Testing ejbs



Hi all, 

what is the best way to Test Classes that run under Application Server
Context
like EJBs? I dont think its possible to instantiate EJBs directly outside
AppServer
Context...Or is it possible?? if possible,is it right way to do??

For testing all the Web Application Classes under a package(com.sun...),
what is the best way to Test all of them?? 

Run all of them as one suite?? If so how??


Pls help,
Regards
Deepak
